name: Larsian Barbeque
address: Don Mariano Cui Street, Capitol Site, Cebu City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"Food: Grilled seafoods and meats. Pusô (hanging rice).

Place: Different stalls with almost the same items on the menu. Location has been renovated so tables and grilling stations are more organized compared to the old one. Be cautious though upon getting your bill as there are times that they add up some items you didn't order. Sum it all up if the amount is correct. You have been warned. 

Price: Affordable."},{"reviewer_text":"Food - Must try when visiting the Queen City of the South!

Place - Located in the heart of Fuente Osmena. Typical ihaw-ihaw place. Different stalls but almost the same items on the menu. Try to look around first before settling on the stall of your choice. Try to haggle as well. 

Price - Affordable. Other's might say prices here are relatively high compared to other ihawan but hey, they have rental obligations and staffs to pay."}]
cost: PHP250 for two people (approx.)

name: Soho Park
address: Ground Floor, Asian Premier Residences, Abad Street, Lahug City, Cebu
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":""},{"reviewer_text":"One server was not accommodating and the other one was fine but she miscalculated our bill. It was an okay experience; the steak was so-so but I don't think I'm coming back. I also think it's too pricey and I could name more restaurants where  I'm willing to pay the same price I spent here."}]

name: J.CO Donuts & Coffee
address: Ground Floor, The Terraces, Ayala Center Cebu, Cebu Business Park, Cebu City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"Craving for donut I have to try their signature donut the Alcapone. A soft donut topped with belgian white chocolate and sprinkle with slices of almond. The dough is very soft and the sweetness is just enough unlike its competition. The almonds and the white belgian chocolate combine with the donut gives a very pleasant taste.
Above it all they also have a very cozy place. Good for hang out or just relax while enjoying a bite of your donut."},{"reviewer_text":"This place rocks the house.
Sometimes I'm in the mood for down and dirty donuts Like Mister Donut, but other times you want what almost can be described as gourmet donuts and that is how I would describe Jco.
Great place to go visit and to get delivery too on Grab or Foodpanda.
Pricy yes but this isn't just a mere donut it's practically a meal in and of itself.
Some of the donuts are like a work of art."}]
cost: PHP500 for two people (approx.)

name: Acacia Steakhouse
address: Green Valley Subdivision, Acacia Street, Capitol Hills, Capitol Site, Cebu City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"5 for the steak, consistency was just right,not too chewy. I just wish there was a little bit more done on the presentation. Aesthetics for the price you pay does add to its value. To add, the staff could be tad bit more friendlier. Smile when you enter and smile when you go."},{"reviewer_text":""}]

name: Tokyo Table
address: City Time Square, Mantawe Avenue, Tipolo, Mandaue City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"One of the best buffets my family and I have been too. You can reserve your seats ahead. 
Food is superb. I get to have my own array of yakiniku choices, and raw seafood (salmon was my fave) at the same time. 
Not to mention, their dessert bar, keeps me coming back for more
So much memories with this restaurant, from birthdays to graduations. 
Sad to hear they have closed after years of operation. Absolutely, would miss this place."},{"reviewer_text":"Sad to hear it’s already closed after 6 years! 😕 follow my instagram for more photo/videos blogs @alnixeats 😋"}]

reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"I love the ambience of this place, it's relaxing. And I'm impressed coz they are open 24 hours a day."},{"reviewer_text":"Craving for sweets and ended up here. Tried there Java Chip Frappe and it was the best that I've tasted so far. Besides from other cafes, I'd prefer Sulbing for my frappe heart."}]

name: Azure Beach Club - Crimson Resort and Spa Mactan
address: Crimson Resort and Spa Mactan, Seascapes Resort Town, Mactan, Cebu, Mactan, Lapu-Lapu City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"If you’re looking for a place to splurge your money on food, this is it. Their dishes are pricey but reasonable since Azure is in a 5-star resort, and it is super worth it because the serving size is big. Their service is great too, so accommodating and welcoming. I love the ambiance because it is by the sea, sad thing is that when we had supper there, there was no view anymore because it is dark. I haven’t captured every dish we had but it was a 3 course meal and I was already getting full after the appetisers, again the servings were BIG and we are 5 in the family. Super worth it."},{"reviewer_text":"Spent my birthday here at Azure Beach Club. Food was pricey but great. They also have a bar by the sea, super cool! Each course ranges from PHP900 to PHP3,000."}]

name: The Thray
address: Grove Building, V Rama Avenue, Guadalupe, Cebu City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"The servings are quite small and in terms of taste, it's okay. You can't really consider it boodle with the small servings. Just a thought for you guys."},{"reviewer_text":"Here's a polite and honest feedback. I hope this will help you improve and get better.
1. The place - maybe adjust the aircon a little bit to make it comfortable especially when it's around lunch time. It was hot when we were there.
2. Anti-mage iced tea - it did not taste like iced tea at all. It was water, sugar and some ice. It's not even cold.
3. We had the Warlock's steak (more like tenderloin slices/ small pieces and not exactly a whole steak) - it took some time for them to serve it but it was not even close to warm when it was brought to our table. The serving portion is too small.
4. Price - not worth the price at all. It's too expensive for a not cold iced tea, cold steak and...read more"}]

name: Feria - Radisson Blu Cebu
address: Radisson Blu Cebu, Juan Luna Avenue Corner Osmena Boulevard, North Reclamation Area, Cebu City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":""},{"reviewer_text":"I've always had the impression from others that Feria didnt have as varied offering as other buffets in the city so when I came to try Feria I was quite pleased to see a lot of options. The carving station had tender and perfectly seasoned meats and the Indian station had some really good selections and their desserts were just perfect for my taste ( not too sweet and I didnt get that \"mass produced\" taste which I commonly get from other buffets). All the dishes I tried gave me the impression that only the freshest ingredients were used to prepare them."}]
dishes: Pizza, Tea, Lunch Buffet, Breakfast Buffet

name: Weekend
address: Pope John Paul II Avenue, The Greenery, Kasambagan, Cebu 6000
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"The most underrated restaurant in Cebu. Definitely a bang for one's buck, you get what you paid for. We ordered five different dishes and all five dishes tasted spectacular, also aesthetically pleasing. The service crew is always smiling, which is also good. I will highly recommend this place!\n\nP.S: If you order the drown in cheese burger, do not forget to mention to the server that the raclette \"cheese\" needs to be poured on top of the patty. NOT ON TOP OF THE FRIES."},{"reviewer_text":"The Fat bastard was just dang!  Worth every buck."}]

name: Balai
address: 1 Floremer Subdivision, A. S. Fortuna Street, Banilad, Mandaue City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"Balai cafe will always be one of those cafés you’ll love to go to- for relaxation from a busy day at work, or at school. Just the perfect place to unwind dor its cozy furnitures and the home vibe it provides, true to it’s name- Balai.
Food was great but what I can really recommend are their drinks. Coffee is what they are really known first next was their roasted chicken."},{"reviewer_text":"Food was good and worth it at its price. I really like the coffee here, too. Ambience was really nice, good place to catch up.

However, we waited for almost two hours for our food to be complete. One of my friends got irritated since when we first followed up for our order, we sensed that they have forgotten about it and told us to wait since the kitchen was busy. We waited for another hour for a salad and a breakfast plate. I think it would be wise if staff would actually write down the customer's orders instead of just memorizing it.

If not for the food, I would think twice on coming back here."}]
cost: PHP500 for two people (approx.) Without alcohol

reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":""},{"reviewer_text":"Today i have to try the signature dish of their restaurant. The Angus Beef Ribeyes steak, Watermelon Juice for the drink and Tokyo Cheesecake for my dessert.-The Angus Beef Ribeyes steak is a combination of Angus Beef side with mashed potato and mix vegetables garnish with rosemary then match with Japanese Steak Sauce. The steak is cook on a medium rare, a bit juicy on the inside and seasoned very well. While the mashed potato is creamy and the mix vegetables is bit salty but it complements with the steak. name: Ding Qua Qua Dimsum House
address: Second Floor, JY Square Discovery Mall, Lahug, Cebu City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"The place is always full when I go but the service is great. This is a great place to eat when hungry but on a budget. The buffet spread is full of their classic dishes so you won't miss anything! There's also a lot available in the buffet so there's lots to choose from. The dessert selection is also really good. A Cebuano staple definitely!!"},{"reviewer_text":"Ding qua qua is a great dimsum place. It is famous for its affordable buffet and really good dimsum. I liked the quail egg dimsum, and the unli steam rice. The wide selection of food makes the buffet worth it - patatim, several dimsum, noodle soup, spring roll, and other meat, buchi, etc. It is good enough. Although i do not see servers most of the time, and ambience is like a typical cheao buffet resto."}]
cost: PHP600 for two people (approx.)

name: The Sails - Movenpick Hotel & Resort
address: Movenpick Hotel & Resort, Punta Engano, Lapu-Lapu City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"Loved the ambiance of this restaurant classy modern and would definitely give you good vibes.
Reason as to why I only rated it 3 stars is because the food selection wasn’t really worth its price. They do have diff themes per day and we went here on a Sunday (east meets west). 
Regular rate is around 1600 PHP per pax and we got discounts thru eatigo and only paid around 825 PHP (one round of drink included) wasn’t really a fan of the food nothing fancy nothing mouth watering food was just okay. Selections were limited. Pizza station, Japanese station (not really fresh), grilling station and dessert station and etc Ambiance of the place really gave us time to just enjoy and take a...read more"},{"reviewer_text":"Food was great!! While there wasn't a lot of variety, the quality of the food available was good and consistent - which is pretty much what you ask for from a buffet

In particular, I loved the lechon belly, the grilling station (beef tenderloin, fish), the freshly baked pizza, the crepes, free flowing Heineken and the calamansi juice. The Japanese station was very sparse though - only maki was available. I'm usually used to a sashimi and tuna spread... Likewise, the fruits selection was great and super sweet. But their other desserts were meh - rather forgettable"}]
type: Fine Dining - Japanese, American, Italian, Filipino, Korean, Chinese
cost: PHP2000 for two people (approx.) Without alcohol

[{"reviewer_text":"PLACE is good. Spacious. Love the seats and the interior as well. I love the atmosphere, family crowd and I’ve seen crowd of old people catching up. 

FOOD was good. I love the panghimagas or dessert. My special fave is the puto bongbong and bibingka! Yummm!!!!  The buko pandan was delish as well. And lumpiang sariwa. Yayyy! They have lots of food, filipino food. 

SERVER was slow. This was the only problem we encountered. Our server was great don’t get me wrong. But the food was very slow. Everytime they put food in our table we finish eat and the next dish took time to be served. It was just frustrating especially when you are

name: Wakamatsu Yakiniku
address: Ground Floor, Pacific Square Building, F. Cabahug Street, Mabolo, Cebu City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"The service was so terrible. We kept on repeating our orders to different waitresses for like around 4 times before they were served. A lot of our orders have also been forgotten and not served. They don’t list your orders and so a lot of it would be forgotten. It was unacceptable and you’d think they’d take a long time preparing the food because it’s going to be really delicious but the quality of the food is not even that good. The sashimi wasn’t fresh, not cut properly and took forever to arrive, and the teppanyaki was messy. The servers also weren’t polite and don’t listen whenever being called even though they’ve already seen you. It’s not just one, it’s all of...read more"},{"reviewer_text":"Asked to have the grill changed at the table, then comes the new grill with a walking live cockroach! Waiter who changed the grill hurriedly caught the roach crawling onto the table. We thought that was it, but then... \nAfter almost finishing my ramen, I WAS SHOCKED to see another bug in the soup!How lucky are we to have 2 bugs for dinner?!?!?\nSee photo for proof. Never coming back here again!!!"}]

name: Hamakaze Ramen Dining & Bar

reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"The food is excellent and very delicious. But the staffs are insulting. We came a group of seven and we requested to arrange the table for us because we want to sit together as a group  but instead they insulted and told us that they can't do that because it's very difficult for them. It was okay for us, and we understand them but the other staff was so irritating because she rolled her eyes when one of my friends ask for additional glass for the beer. Good thing my friend, didn't see it. Hahaha. My friend is a war freak."},{"reviewer_text":"Okay my friend recommended this place so we want to try it out. We've been to sashi and yushoken, and this place serve chicken broth soup. So for
food: 3 star out of 5, the noodles and pork is goood. However soup is okay. We ordered, shoyu and spicy shoyu and gyōza.
Place: 4 star out of 5, homieee, they have parking.
Staff: 1 star out of 5, not polite. They heard us criticising they're food specially the noodles. And they dont want to talk to us or serve us. Not cool guys."}]

reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"My family & I went here for lunch and we were one of the few customers who arrived just as they opened at 11:30am.

I love the interiors.. fancy & spacious. However, the seats assigned to us (Table #85 I think.. the ones near the restroom & japanese station with the half circle couches) had a damaged couch so it was so uncomfortable because it just kept tickling my thighs. LOL. I had to pull out a separate chair. Did not bother ask to be seated at another table because the lady who escorted us to our seats seemed to be in a rush.

I roamed around to check all of the food available before adding them to my plate but there were very limited food options as compared to Vikings.

I loved the...read more"}]

name: Chik Chow Food Express Buffet
address: 316 - C General Maxilom Avenue, Kamputhaw, Cebu City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"I love the place! It's not easily discoverable though because it's not at the side of the street, they need bigger signs so people would be able to see them. Went here with a co-teacher when I was still teaching. Their food is good! Although they dont have that much food choices, the Filipino-Chinese brand is really present. I think it's 300 per person. I also think you need to make reservations before you go there because it's not a huge and spacious place."},{"reviewer_text":"Been here 6 times. The lengua and the all-meat dinugoan keeps calling me back. But they do need to introduce a few more dishes to the mix. The location is very much accessible and parking is plentiful. However, the attendants are a little bit too at home, with their loud conversations. Some piped-in soft music would be nice, to drown some of the noise from neighboring tables."}]

name: Coffee Factory
address: A. S. Fortuna Street, Banilad, Mandaue City
reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"one of the recent orders arrived with just half of the content since the take-out order wasn't properly sealed. Still ordered the next day for take-away, and wrote on the instructions that they seal it properly. Was surprised the order arrived with a voucher since i didn't ask for it, only to realize it was a generic foodpanda voucher for NEW user. what a joke. How can i be a NEW user when I've been using food panda to order from them? But since, they open early, i made another order again. After waiting, instead of a hot latte, i received an iced one. I double checked my foodpanda order to see if i made a mistake but no, especially that i order the same drink everytime. So i called their...read more"},{"reviewer_text":"This place is one of the best to study in. It is really quiet wherein all you'll hear is the sound of their music and the sound of the blenders making drinks. It also provides different types of areas to study in. There's an outdoor roadside setting, a sofa type setting, a high stool bar type and even a big table setting. It's great for those who want to really study or have a peaceful place to just stay in. Their Lemon Tea is also delicious."}]

reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":"Our go-to ramen place."},{"reviewer_text":"It was really my first time eating at this restau. When we dined, there wasn't so much people so eventhough the place was small we had ample seating and I would not need to worry our elbows might get hurt from passing diners. I love the ambiance, although, it was a little messy, I can still feel the japanese-y vibe in it. I love that they have an open kitchen, it gives me an idea on how my food was prepared and an idea for future business/ running a kitchen preferrences. Also, their attendants were very attentive 😅. reviewer_text: [{"reviewer_text":""},{"reviewer_text":"Great customer service. name: Dolce
address: Panorama Heights, Nivel Hills, Lahug, Cebu City
reviewer_text:
[{"reviewer_text":"Came here with my Valentine's date and we sat outside. I was kinda disappointed about almost everything I experienced here.
☑ They don't have Meals, Sandwiches & Burgers available at the moment. So we just opt for their Carbonara. I was about to get the Penne Pasta but again, they only have the Spaghetti one. So I had no option.
✅ I like the pasta, it's creamy and seasoned well. They have a large serving too.
☑ I expected the bread to be crunchy but it's the exact opposite. Nothing too special with their blueberry cheesecake, I didn't taste the very hint of blueberry and the slice is very small for its price. Also, the Mango shake is great but they could have served it in a glass...read more"},{"reviewer_text":"Legit ambiance, perfect for catching up, long night talks and group conversations.. Spaces not overcrowded, and just right for large groups.. Also has indoor and outdoor areas depending on your preference!"}]
